On Mon, 24 May 2004 18:30:10 -0700 (PDT), Karl Lewin
<lewinke67@...> wrote:
> I hadn't read the Watson/Noble stuff.  Thanks for the
> pointer.  

No problem.

> I'd be more than happy to discuss ideas and such.  Be
> warned I'm not much of a trained researcher more of an
> interested hobbiest.

Well, neither are Philip and I.  We both work day jobs (Philip's a
Java developer and I design web-based training) and do this stuff in
our spare time.  So no worries there.

We're also not experts in any particular domain.  Billings and
Davidson obviously know quite a lot about poker.  I know enough to
implement a tournament framework and take some reasonable stabs at a
good fitness function, but I'm a pretty poor player.  Likewise with
Go.

Derek
